showBootscreen.notes: Show the Marlin bootscreen on startup. ** ENABLE FOR PRODUCTION **

showCustomBootscreen.notes: Show the bitmap in Marlin/_Bootscreen.h on startup.

customMachineName.notes: Name displayed in the LCD "Ready" message and Info menu

machineUuid.notes: Printer's unique ID, used by some programs to differentiate between machines. Choose your own or use a service like https://www.uuidgenerator.net/version4

extruders.notes: @section extruder This defines the number of extruders :[0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8]

nominalFilamentDia.notes: Generally expected filament diameter (1.75, 2.85, 3.0, ...). Used for Volumetric, Filament Width Sensor, etc.

customStatusScreenImage.notes: Show the bitmap in Marlin/_Statusscreen.h on the status screen.

examples: // Enable G-code M575 to set the baud rate

bluetooth.notes: Enable the Bluetooth serial interface on AT90USB devices

singlenozzle.notes: For Cyclops or any "multi-extruder" that shares a single nozzle.

switchingExtruder.notes: A dual extruder that uses a single stepper motor

switchingNozzle.notes: A dual-nozzle that uses a servomotor to raise/lower one (or both) of the nozzles

examples: // If enabled, the solenoid is NOT magnetized with applied voltage
// Prime the nozzle before release from the dock
// Allow ABCDHI mix factors in G1 movement commands
// Support for gradient mixing with M166 and LCD
// Add M166 T to use a V-tool index as a Gradient alias

hotendOffsetX.notes: Offset of the extruders (uncomment if using more than one and relying on firmware to position when changing). The offset has to be X=0, Y=0 for the extruder 0 hotend (default extruder). For the other hotends it is their distance from the extruder 0 hotend.

examples: // Keep power off until enabled directly with M80
// Enable automatic control of the PS_ON pin
// Turn on PSU if fans need power

dummyThermistor998Value.notes: Dummy thermistor constant temperature readings, for use with 998 and 999

max31865SensorOhms0.notes: Resistor values when using MAX31865 sensors (-5) on TEMP_SENSOR_0 / 1

kpList.notes: Specify between 1 and HOTENDS values per array. If fewer than EXTRUDER values are provided, the last element will be repeated.

bedkp.notes: 120V 250W silicone heater into 4mm borosilicate (MendelMax 1.5+) from FOPDT model - kp=.39 Tp=405 Tdead=66, Tc set to 79.2, aggressive factor of .15 (vs .1, 1, 10)

chamberkp.notes: Lasko "MyHeat Personal Heater" (200w) modified with a Fotek SSR-10DA to control only the heating element and placed inside the small Creality printer enclosure tent.

examples: // Limit edit via M203 or LCD to DEFAULT_MAX_FEEDRATE * 2
// Limit edit via M201 or LCD to DEFAULT_MAX_ACCELERATION * 2
// Use curvature estimation instead of just the junction angle

duetSmartEffector.notes: Duet Smart Effector (for delta printers) - https://bit.ly/2ul5U7J When the pin is defined you can use M672 to set/reset the probe sensivity.

probingMargin.notes: Most probes should stay away from the edges of the bed, but with NOZZLE_AS_PROBE this can be negative for a wider probing area.

pauseBeforeDeployStow.notes: Before deploy/stow pause for user confirmation

examples: // Wait for hotend to heat back up between probes (to improve accuracy & prevent cold extrude)
// Turn steppers off (unless needed to hold position) when probing

xEnableOn.notes: For Inverting Stepper Enable Pins (Active Low) use 0, Non Inverting (Active High) use 1 :{ 0:'Low', 1:'High' }

disableX.notes: Disable axis steppers immediately when they're not being stepped. WARNING: When motors turn off there is a chance of losing position accuracy!

disableReducedAccuracyWarning.notes: Turn off the display blinking that warns about possible accuracy reduction

examples: // Keep only the active extruder enabled

invertXDir.notes: @section machine Invert the stepper direction. Change (or reverse the motor connector) if an axis goes the wrong way.

invertE0Dir.notes: @section extruder For direct drive extruder v9 set to true, for geared extruder set to false.

examples: // Inhibit movement until all axes have been homed. Also enable HOME_AFTER_DEACTIVATE for extra safety.

zAfterHoming.notes: Be sure to have this much clearance over your Z_MAX_POS to prevent grinding.

examples: // Use internal pullup for filament runout pins.
// Use internal pulldown for filament runout pins.
// Execute runout script on any triggering sensor, not only for the active extruder.

filRunout1State.notes: This is automatically enabled for MIXING_EXTRUDERs. Override individually if the runout sensors vary

filamentMotionSensor.notes: Enable this option to use an encoder disc that toggles the runout pin as the filament moves. (Be sure to set FILAMENT_RUNOUT_DISTANCE_MM large enough to avoid false positives.)

segmentLeveledMoves.notes: For Cartesian machines, instead of dividing moves on mesh boundaries, split up moves into short segments like a Delta. This follows the contours of the bed more closely than edge-to-edge straight moves.

extrapolateBeyondGrid.notes: Beyond the probed grid, continue the implied tilt? Default is to maintain the height of the nearest edge.

ablBilinearSubdivision.notes: Experimental Subdivision of the grid by Catmull-Rom method. Synthesizes intermediate points to produce a more detailed mesh.

bilinearSubdivisions.notes: Number of subdivisions between probe points

examples: // Use Hilbert distribution for less travel when probing multiple points
// Save the currently active mesh in the current slot on M500
// Move to the center after the last corner
// After adjustment triggers the probe, re-probe to verify

xySkewFactor.notes: Or, set the default skew factors directly here to override the above measurements:

skewCorrectionGcode.notes: Enable this option for M852 to set skew at runtime

examples: // Saves ~2700 bytes of PROGMEM. Disable for release!
// Disable this if your host doesn't like keepalive messages
hostKeepaliveFeature.notes: Host Keepalive  When enabled Marlin will send a busy status message to the host every couple of seconds when it can't accept commands.

examples: // Some hosts require "busy" messages even during heating

nozzleCleanStartPoint.notes: Specify positions for each tool as { { X, Y, Z }, { X, Y, Z } } Dual hotend system may use { {  -20, (Y_BED_SIZE / 2), (Z_MIN_POS + 1) },  {  420, (Y_BED_SIZE / 2), (Z_MIN_POS + 1) }}

nozzleCleanGoback.notes: Move the nozzle to the initial position after cleaning

nozzleCleanNoZ.notes: For a purge/clean station that's always at the gantry height (thus no Z move)

nozzleCleanNoY.notes: For a purge/clean station mounted on the X axis

examples: // Heat up the nozzle instead of skipping wipe

wipeSequenceCommands.notes: Explicit wipe G-code script applies to a G12 with no arguments.

examples: // Unlock with the M511 P<password> command. Disable to prevent brute-force attack.
// Change the password with M512 P<old> S<new>.

encoderPulsesPerStep.notes: ENCODER SETTINGS  This option overrides the default number of encoder pulses needed to produce one step. Should be increased for high-resolution encoders.

encoderStepsPerMenuItem.notes: Use this option to override the number of step signals required to move between next/prev menu items.

reverseEncoderDirection.notes: This option reverses the encoder direction everywhere.  Set this option if CLOCKWISE causes values to DECREASE

reverseMenuDirection.notes: This option reverses the encoder direction for navigating LCD menus.  If CLOCKWISE normally moves DOWN this makes it go UP. If CLOCKWISE normally moves UP this makes it go DOWN.

reverseSelectDirection.notes: This option reverses the encoder direction for Select Screen.  If CLOCKWISE normally moves LEFT this makes it go RIGHT. If CLOCKWISE normally moves RIGHT this makes it go LEFT.

individualAxisHomingMenu.notes: Individual Axis Homing  Add individual axis homing items (Home X, Home Y, and Home Z) to the LCD menu.

speaker.notes: SPEAKER/BUZZER  If you have a speaker that can produce tones, enable it here. By default Marlin assumes you have a buzzer with a fixed frequency.

yhcb2004.notes: GT2560 (YHCB2004) LCD Display  Requires Testato, Koepel softwarewire library and Andriy Golovnya's LiquidCrystal_AIP31068 library.

panelOne.notes: PanelOne from T3P3 (via RAMPS 1.4 AUX2/AUX3) https://reprap.org/wiki/PanelOne

g3dPanel.notes: GADGETS3D G3D LCD/SD Controller https://reprap.org/wiki/RAMPS_1.3/1.4_GADGETS3D_Shield_with_Panel  Note: Usually sold with a blue PCB.

raControlPanel.notes: ============================================================================= ======================== LCD / Controller Selection ========================= =====================   (I2C and Shift-Register LCDs)   ===================== =============================================================================  CONTROLLER TYPE: I2C  Note: These controllers require the installation of Arduino's LiquidCrystal_I2C library. For more info: https://github.com/kiyoshigawa/LiquidCrystal_I2C   Elefu RA Board Control Panel http://www.elefu.com/index.php?route=product/product&product_id=53

ffInterfaceboard.notes: 3-wire SR LCD with strobe using 74HC4094 https://github.com/mikeshub/SailfishLCD Uses the code directly from Sailfish

viki2.notes: Activate one of these if you have a Panucatt Devices Viki 2.0 or mini Viki with Graphic LCD https://www.panucatt.com

minipanel.notes: MakerLab Mini Panel with graphic controller and SD support - https://reprap.org/wiki/Mini_panel

makrpanel.notes: MaKr3d Makr-Panel with graphic controller and SD support. https://reprap.org/wiki/MaKr3d_MaKrPanel

mksMini12864.notes: MKS MINI12864 with graphic controller and SD support https://reprap.org/wiki/MKS_MINI_12864

examples: // Type C/D/E/F. No tunable RGB Backlight by default
fysetcMini12864XX.notes: FYSETC variant of the MINI12864 graphic controller with SD support https://wiki.fysetc.com/Mini12864_Panel/

examples: // Type C/D/E/F. Simple RGB Backlight (always on)
// Larger display with basic ON/OFF backlight.

mks12864oled.notes: MKS OLED 1.3" 128×64 Full Graphics Controller https://reprap.org/wiki/MKS_12864OLED  Tiny, but very sharp OLED display

overlordOled.notes: Overlord OLED display/controller with i2c buzzer and LEDs

fysetc242Oled12864.notes: FYSETC OLED 2.42" 128×64 Full Graphics Controller with WS2812 RGB Where to find : https://www.aliexpress.com/item/4000345255731.html

touchUiFtdiEve.notes: Touch UI for FTDI EVE (FT800/FT810) displays See Configuration_adv.h for all configuration options.

nextionTft.notes: 320x240 Nextion 2.8" serial TFT Resistive Touch Screen NX3224T028

extensibleUi.notes: Third-party or vendor-customized controller interfaces. Sources should be installed in 'src/lcd/extui'.

examples: // Enables use of local Beeper pin with external display

mksTs35V20.notes: 480x320, 3.5", SPI Display From MKS Normally used in MKS Robin Nano V2

mksRobinTft24.notes: 320x240, 2.4", FSMC Display From MKS Normally used in MKS Robin Nano V1.2

mksRobinTft28.notes: 320x240, 2.8", FSMC Display From MKS Normally used in MKS Robin Nano V1.2

mksRobinTft32.notes: 320x240, 3.2", FSMC Display From MKS Normally used in MKS Robin Nano V1.2

mksRobinTft35.notes: 480x320, 3.5", FSMC Display From MKS Normally used in MKS Robin Nano V1.2

mksRobinTftV11r.notes: 320x240, 3.2", FSMC Display From MKS Normally used in MKS Robin

tftInterfaceFsmc.notes: Interface. Enable one of the following options:

tftRes320x240.notes: TFT Resolution. Enable one of the following options:

examples: // Auto save successful calibration values to EEPROM

fastPwmFan.notes: Increase the FAN PWM frequency. Removes the PWM noise but increases heating in the FET/Arduino

fanSoftPwm.notes: Use software PWM to drive the fan, as for the heaters. This uses a very low frequency which is not as annoying as with the hardware PWM. On the other hand, if this frequency is too low, you should also increment SOFT_PWM_SCALE.

softPwmScale.notes: Incrementing this by 1 will double the software PWM frequency, affecting heaters, and the fan if FAN_SOFT_PWM is enabled. However, control resolution will be halved for each increment; at zero value, there are 128 effective control positions. :[0,1,2,3,4,5,6,7]

softPwmDither.notes: If SOFT_PWM_SCALE is set to a value higher than 0, dithering can be used to mitigate the associated resolution loss. If enabled, some of the PWM cycles are stretched so on average the desired duty cycle is attained.

baricuda.notes: Support for the BariCUDA Paste Extruder

pca9632.notes: Support for PCA9632 PWM LED driver

pca9533.notes: Support for PCA9533 PWM LED driver

neopixelLed.notes: Support for Adafruit NeoPixel LED driver

examples: // Sequential display for temperature change - LED by LED. Disable to change all LEDs at once.

neopixel2Separate.notes: Support for second Adafruit NeoPixel LED driver controlled with M150 S1 ...

examples: // Default behavior is NeoPixel 2 in parallel

neopixelBkgdIndexFirst.notes: Use some of the NeoPixel LEDs for static (background) lighting

examples: // Keep the backlight on when other NeoPixels are off

servoDelay.notes: (ms) Delay  before the next move will start, to give the servo time to reach its target angle. 300ms is a good value but you can try less delay. If the servo can't reach the requested position, increase it.

deactivateServosAfterMove.notes: Only power servos during movement, otherwise leave off to prevent jitter

editableServoAngles.notes: Edit servo angles with M281 and save to EEPROM with M500

examples: // Add PID editing to the "Advanced Settings" menu. (~700 bytes of PROGMEM)
// Add PID auto-tuning to the "Advanced Settings" menu. (~250 bytes of PROGMEM)
// Uses separate PID parameters for each extruder (useful for mismatched extruders)
// Sends debug data to the serial port.
// Sends debug data to the serial port.
// Sends debug data to the serial port. Use 'M303 D' to toggle activation.
// Puts PID in open loop. M104/M140 sets the output power from 0 to PID_MAX
// PWM with very low frequency (roughly 0.125Hz=8s) and minimum state time of approximately 1s useful for heaters driven by a relay
// Enable thermal protection for all extruders
// Enable thermal protection for the heated bed
// Enable thermal protection for the heated chamber
// Enable thermal protection for the laser cooling
// Wait for bed to heat back up between probes (to improve accuracy)

preheatBeforeProbing.notes: Require minimum nozzle and/or bed temperature for probing

xBedSize.notes: @section machine The size of the printable area

levelBedCorners.notes: Add a menu item to move between bed corners for manual bed adjustment

bedCenterAt00.notes: @section homing The center of the bed is at (X=0, Y=0)

preheat1Label.notes: @section temperature  Preheat Constants - Up to 5 are supported without changes

nozzleCleanMinTemp.notes: Require a minimum hotend temperature for cleaning

tempStatLeds.notes: Temperature status LEDs that display the hotend and bed temperature. If all hotends, bed temperature, and target temperature are under 54C then the BLUE led is on. Otherwise the RED led is on. (1C hysteresis)

examples: // Manual control of docking solenoids with M380 S / M381

xMinPos.notes: Travel limits (mm) after homing, corresponding to endstop positions.

manualProbeStartZ.notes: Set a height for the start of manual adjustment

manualXHomePos.notes: Manually set the home position. Leave these undefined for automatic settings. For DELTA this is the top-center of the Cartesian print volume.

examples: // Limit edit via M205 or LCD to DEFAULT_aJERK * 2

xyProbeFeedrate.notes: X and Y axis travel speed (mm/min) between probes

zProbeFeedrateFast.notes: Feedrate (mm/min) for the first approach when double-probing (MULTIPLE_PROBING == 2)

zProbeFeedrateSlow.notes: Feedrate (mm/min) for the "accurate" probe of each point

tempSensor1AsRedundant.notes: Use temp sensor 1 as a redundant sensor with sensor 0. If the readings from the two sensors differ too much the print will be aborted.

heater0Mintemp.notes: Below this temperature the heater will be switched off because it probably indicates a broken thermistor wire.

heater0Maxtemp.notes: Above this temperature the heater will be switched off. This can protect components from overheating, but NOT from shorts and failures. (Use MINTEMP for thermistor short/failure protection.)

lcdFeedbackFrequencyDurationMs.notes: The duration and frequency for the UI feedback sound. Set these to 0 to disable audio feedback in the LCD menus.  Note: Test audio output with the G-Code: M300 S<frequency Hz> P<duration ms>

makeboardMini2LineDisplay1602.notes: Makeboard 3D Printer Parts 3D Printer Mini Display 1602 Mini Controller https://www.aliexpress.com/item/32765887917.html

examples: // Requires ADC_KEYPAD_PIN to be assigned to an analog pin.

ultraLcd.notes: This LCD is known to be susceptible to electrical interference which scrambles the display.  Pressing any button clears it up. This is a LCD2004 display with 5 analog buttons.  Generic 16x2, 16x4, 20x2, or 20x4 character-based LCD.

lcdSainsmartI2c1602.notes: Sainsmart (YwRobot) LCD Displays  These require F.Malpartida's LiquidCrystal_I2C library https://bitbucket.org/fmalpartida/new-liquidcrystal/wiki/Home

lcdI2cPanelolu2.notes: PANELOLU2 LCD with status LEDs, separate encoder and click inputs.  Note: This controller requires Arduino's LiquidTWI2 library v1.2.3 or later. For more info: https://github.com/lincomatic/LiquidTWI2  Note: The PANELOLU2 encoder click input can either be directly connected to a pin (if BTN_ENC defined to != -1) or read through I2C (when BTN_ENC == -1).

lcdI2cViki.notes: Panucatt VIKI LCD with status LEDs, integrated click & L/R/U/D buttons, separate encoder inputs.

sav3dlcd.notes: CONTROLLER TYPE: Shift register panels   2-wire Non-latching LCD SR from https://goo.gl/aJJ4sH LCD configuration: https://reprap.org/wiki/SAV_3D_LCD

tftglcdPanelSpi.notes: TFT GLCD Panel with Marlin UI Panel connected to main board by SPI or I2C interface. See https://github.com/Serhiy-K/TFTGLCDAdapter

reprapDiscountFullGraphicSmartController.notes: ============================================================================= =======================   LCD / Controller Selection  ======================= =========================      (Graphical LCDs)      ======================== =============================================================================  CONTROLLER TYPE: Graphical 128x64 (DOGM)  IMPORTANT: The U8glib library is required for Graphical Display! https://github.com/olikraus/U8glib_Arduino  NOTE: If the LCD is unresponsive you may need to reverse the plugs.   RepRapDiscount FULL GRAPHIC Smart Controller https://reprap.org/wiki/RepRapDiscount_Full_Graphic_Smart_Controller

bqLcdSmartController.notes: BQ LCD Smart Controller shipped by default with the BQ Hephestos 2 and Witbox 2.

lcdForMelzi.notes: LCD for Melzi Card with Graphical LCD

ultiController.notes: Original Ulticontroller from Ultimaker 2 printer with SSD1309 I2C display and encoder https://github.com/Ultimaker/Ultimaker2/tree/master/1249_Ulticontroller_Board_(x1)

mksLcd12864a.notes: MKS LCD12864A/B with graphic controller and SD support. Follows MKS_MINI_12864 pinout. https://www.aliexpress.com/item/33018110072.html

cr10Stockdisplay.notes: Factory display for Creality CR-10 https://www.aliexpress.com/item/32833148327.html  This is RAMPS-compatible using a single 10-pin connector. (For CR-10 owners who want to replace the Melzi Creality board but retain the display)

ender2Stockdisplay.notes: Ender-2 OEM display, a variant of the MKS_MINI_12864

anetFullGraphicsLcd.notes: ANET and Tronxy Graphical Controller  Anet 128x64 full graphics lcd with rotary encoder as used on Anet A6 A clone of the RepRapDiscount full graphics display but with different pins/wiring (see pins_ANET_10.h). Enable one of these.

sav3dglcd.notes: SAV OLEd LCD module support using either SSD1306 or SH1106 based LCD modules

k3d242OledController.notes: K.3D SSD1309 OLED 2.42" 128×64 Full Graphics Controller

malyanLcd.notes: Touch-screen LCD for Malyan M200/M300 printers

xminPlug.notes: =========================================================================== ============================== Endstop Settings =========================== =========================================================================== @section homing Specify here all the endstop connectors that are connected to any endstop or probe. Almost all printers will be using one per axis. Probes will use one or more of the extra connectors. Leave undefined any used for non-endstop and non-probe purposes.

endstoppullups.notes: Enable pullup for all endstops to prevent a floating state

endstoppullupXmax.notes: Disable ENDSTOPPULLUPS to set pullups individually

endstoppulldowns.notes: Enable pulldown for all endstops to prevent a floating state

endstoppulldownXmax.notes: Disable ENDSTOPPULLDOWNS to set pulldowns individually

xMinEndstopInverting.notes: Mechanical endstop with COM to ground and NC to Signal uses "false" here (most common setup).

endstopInterruptsFeature.notes: Enable this feature if all enabled endstop pins are interrupt-capable. This will remove the need to poll the interrupt pins, saving many CPU cycles.

detectBrokenEndstop.notes: Check for stuck or disconnected endstops during homing moves.

examples: // Require rehoming after steppers are deactivated. Also enable NO_MOTION_BEFORE_HOMING for extra safety.

minSoftwareEndstops.notes: Min software endstops constrain movement within minimum coordinate bounds

maxSoftwareEndstops.notes: Max software endstops constrain movement within maximum coordinate bounds

examples: // Enable/Disable software endstops from the LCD

validateHomingEndstops.notes: Validate that endstops are triggered on homing moves

probeForZHoming.notes: Force the use of the probe for Z-axis homing

solenoidProbe.notes: A probe that is deployed and stowed with a solenoid pin (SOL1_PIN)

zProbeSled.notes: A sled-mounted probe like those designed by Charles Bell.

rackAndPinionProbe.notes: A probe deployed by moving the x-axis, such as the Wilson II's rack-and-pinion probe designed by Marty Rice.

examples: // Fail to tare/probe if PROBE_ACTIVATION_SWITCH is active

zProbeOffsetRangeMin.notes: For M851 give a range for adjusting the Z probe offset

zMinProbeRepeatabilityTest.notes: Enable the M48 repeatability test to test probe accuracy

probeYFirst.notes: Probe along the Y axis, advancing X after each column

filamentRunoutScript.notes: Commands to execute on filament runout. With multiple runout sensors use the %c placeholder for the current tool in commands (e.g., "M600 T%c") NOTE: After 'M412 H1' the host handles filament runout and this script does not apply.

filamentRunoutDistanceMm.notes: After a runout is detected, continue printing this length of filament before executing the runout script. Useful for a sensor at the end of a feed tube. Requires 4 bytes SRAM per sensor, plus 4 bytes overhead.

levelingFadeHeight.notes: Gradually reduce leveling correction until a set height is reached, at which point movement will be level to the machine's XY plane. The height can be set with M420 Z<height>

gridMaxPointsX.notes: Set the number of grid points per dimension.

examples: // Display a graphics overlay while editing the mesh
// Sophisticated users prefer no movement of nozzle
// Run several commands in a row to get a complete mesh
// After homing all axes ('G28' or 'G28 XYZ') rest Z at Z_MIN_POS
// Add a menu to edit mesh points

zSafeHoming.notes: Use "Z Safe Homing" to avoid homing with a Z probe outside the bed area.  With this feature enabled:  - Allow Z homing only after X and Y homing AND stepper drivers still enabled. - If stepper drivers time out, it will need X and Y homing again before Z homing. - Move the Z probe (or nozzle) to a defined XY point before Z Homing. - Prevent Z homing when the Z probe is outside bed area.

examples: // Persistent storage with M500 and M501
// Give feedback on EEPROM commands. Disable to save PROGMEM.
// Keep M503 quiet and only give errors during first load
// Init EEPROM automatically on any errors.

nozzleParkPoint.notes: Specify a park position as { X, Y, Z_raise }

examples: // X move only is required to park
// Y move only is required to park
// This does not prevent gcodes from running
